Job-Title: Researcher - Machine Learning for 3D Reconstruction and Computer Graphics
Description:
The Fraunhofer IIS »Audio and Media Technologies« division has been making its mark on media digitalization for over 30 years, developing pioneering standards such as MP3 and AAC. Motivated by this success, we aim to address new challenges in 3D reconstruction for media and communication applications.

What you will do

You love finding creative solutions for tricky challenges? You are passionate about computer graphics and machine learning?

Then join our team to use machine learning for better 3D reconstruction.

Your task will be the conceptual design of algorithms that allow an encompassing digital representation of photographed scenes. This includes the retrieval of 3D geometry, optical material properties and illumination conditions. By means of machine learning and neuronal networks, you solve open challenges in 3D reconstruction. This also includes the efficient compression and rendering of the generated 3D models. You monitor the progress in scientific publications and... extract the key concepts to combine them to novel algorithms with better performance. In collaboration with a team, you create prototype implementations, evaluate their performance and document the findings

Job-Title: Master thesis in the area of Deep Learning for Uncertainty Quantification of...
Description:
We, the BMW Group, offer you an interesting and diverse master thesis in the area of computer vision on uncertainty quantification. At BMW, we develop a variety of robots that support our internal logistics processes in the production plants. Be part of our computer vision team in an innovative and international environment with flat hierarchies and high personal responsibility for projects and tasks.

What awaits you?
• You will be writing your master thesis in the computer vision team and contribute to our research for logistic grasping robots.
• You will be researching the state of the art in uncertainty quantification for deep neural networks in application for object pose estimation and select appropriate concepts.
• You will be implementing, adapting and evaluating your selected concepts on logistic grasping robots in realistic logistic environments.

Please note that the supervision of your thesis by a university must be ensured on your part.

What should you bring along?
•... Currently enrolled in a university program in the field of Computer Science, or Software Engineering or related studies (e.g., Robotics).
• Strong knowledge and experience in Computer Vision, Machine Learning and related packages (e.g., OpenCV, PyTorch).
• Strong knowledge in Python.
• Experience in Software Engineering principles and related concepts (e.g., test-driven development, code reviews, Git branching, etc.)
• Ideally, demonstrated the qualifications in real-world projects and Unix / Ubuntu, ROS, Docker.
• Ability to speak and write in English fluently, German is advantageous.

Do you enjoy learning new things and broaden your horizon? Apply now!

Earliest starting date: 01.09.2022

Duration: 6 months

Working time: full-time

Contact:
BMW Group Recruiting Team
+49 89 382-17001

Job-Title: Software Engineer - High Performance Computing / Artificial Intelligence ...
Description:
Work group:JSC – Jülich Supercomputing CentreArea of research:Scientific / postdoctoral postsJob description:Your Job:As part of the ATML Applied Machine Learning, you will develop scalable High-Performance Computing techniques that allow training large Machine Learning models on the largest supercomputer in Europe.In more details, your work comprises:
Developing scalable, efficient training algorithms for various applications

Identifying and implementing new application of ML in science and technology

Support supercomputer user in effectively and efficiently using our machines for AI

Contribute to the growing training program for AI on supercomputers

Engage in national and international ML/DL communities, especially in helmholtz.ai, the AI community (https://www.helmholtz.ai/)

Present research results at scientific meetings, conferences, and as scientific papers

Your Profile:
Excellent Master or preferably PhD degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics... Natural/Engineering science or similar fields

Broad interest in scientific topics

Good knowledge in AI and applied Machine Learning

Practical experience with High Performance Computing Systems as well as parallel/distributed programming and/or solid UNIX skills

Practical experience with ML/DL workflows and common software libraries

Your experience should be documented in research papers and Open Source code projects

Self-motivated personality, curiosity of working in a multi-disciplinary team environment on scientifically challenging problems

Very good command of written and spoken English

Our Offer:We work on the very latest issues that impact our society and are offering you the chance to actively help in shaping the change! We support you in your work with:
Work on frontiers of scientific and technological challenges with access to cutting-edge and unique supercomputing systems including Quantum Computers and the upcoming first Exascale computer in Europe

A large research campus with green spaces, offering the best possible means for networking with colleagues and pursuing sports alongside work

Comprehensive training courses and individual opportunities for personal and professional further development

Extensive company health management

Ideal conditions for balancing work and private life, as well as a family-friendly corporate policy

Flexible working hours in a full-time position with the option of slightly reduced working hours

Flexible work (location) arrangements, e.g. partly remote work

30 days of annual leave and provision for days off between public holidays and weekends (e.g. between Christmas and New Year)

Targeted services for international employees, e.g. through our International Advisory Service

We offer you an exciting and varied role in an international and interdisciplinary working environment. The position is initially for a fixed term of 2 years, with possible long-term prospects. Salary and social benefits will conform to the provisions of the Collective Agreement for the Public Service (TVöD-Bund) depending on the applicant’s qualifications and the precise nature of the tasks assigned to them.We welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds, e.g. in terms of age, gender, disability, sexual orientation / identity, and social, ethnic and religious origin. A diverse and inclusive working environment with equal opportunities in which everyone can realize their potential is important to us.This research center is part of the Helmholtz Association of German Research Centers. With more than 42,000 employees and an annual budget of over € 5 billion, the Helmholtz Association is Germany’s largest scientific organisation

Job-Title: Postdoctoral Scientist, Machine Learning: Cell Therapy
Description:
Janssen Research & Development (“JRD”), a Johnson & Johnson company, is recruiting for a Postdoctoral Scientist, Machine Learning: Cell Therapy, with the focus on High Dimensional Optimization and Decision Theory.

This position can be in multiple countries: Germany (Berlin or Neuss), Belgium (Beerse), Netherlands (Leiden), Spain (Madrid), United Kingdom (Buckinghamshire), Spring House, PA & La Jolla, CA.

Remote working may be considered on a case by case basis and if approved by the Company.

This is a 2-year fixed term contract, with up to 15% travel.

Janssen develops treatments that improve the health of people worldwide. Research and development areas encompass oncology, cardiovascular and metabolic disorders, immunology, pulmonary hypertension, neuroscience, and infectious disease. Our goal is to help people live longer, healthier lives. We have produced and marketed many first-in-class prescription medications and are poised to serve the broad needs of the healthcare market –... from patients to practitioners and from clinics to hospitals. To learn more about Janssen, one of the Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, visit https://www.janssen.com/janssen-rnd-data-science

The Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning team within Janssen R&D Data Science organization develops innovative insights and solutions by using multi modal datasets, advanced algorithms, and high performance computing across multiple disease areas.

We are looking for an outstanding post-doctoral scientist whose responsibilities will include:
• Analyze biochemical and biological datasets from various R&D labs to enhance the understanding of cell-level attributes by using high-dimensional data analysis and machine learning.
• Build novel or enhance existing machine learning/deep learning algorithms for AI-assisted discovery and development.
• Guide the design of new experiments and build predictive models by using supervised and unsupervised machine learning on historical experiments.
• Actively participate in building modeling and simulation pipelines to develop reusable software assets for the cell therapy platform.
• Participate in experimental design activities in collaboration with therapeutics discovery teams across Janssen, such as defining “what” and “why” particular quality attribute needs to be monitored.
• Communicate results to internal collaborators and external partners through project reports and peer-reviewed research publications

Intro

We are looking for you as an addition to our tech-team in ​Berlin, Hamburg or Munich.

1KOMMA5° is building Germany’s largest one-stop-shop for sale, installation and services related to solar, electricity storage and charging infrastructure. Be a part of our misson!

Your mission
• Build MLOps on Cloud (GCP)
• Build CI/CD Pipelines Orchestration by GitLab CI, GitHub Actions or similar tools
• Build end-to-end data pipelines to enable training and running of machine learning models
• Set-up and train machine learning models initially with AutoML and switch to VertexAI or similar to advance further
• Develop measures of data and model quality, and automated tests of the quality of data powered features
• Integrate code into data pipelines
• Communicating with different teams regarding coding consistency and data availability
• Taking care of data infrastructure and delivering highly available services to production

Your profile
• BSc/MSc in Computer Science or related.
•... Practical knowledge designing and building software applications in cloud environments.
• Strong experience designing, building and deploying machine learning models at scale.
• Experience with MLOps Frameworks like Kubeflow
• No stranger to Docker and Kubernetes
• Worked with Programming languages like Python and/or Ruby
• Good understanding of statistical concepts related to machine learning (data preparation & model evaluation stats, data distributions, descriptive stats, hypothesis testing…)
• Knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases
• Passionate about data
• Professional experience training and deploying machine learning applications in Google Cloud
• Experience with BigQuery, TensorFlow and ideally Vertex AI
• You have an agile and result-oriented mindset and you consider yourself a team player
• Very good knowledge of spoken and written English, German is a plus

Why us?
• The opportunity to travel, work mobile and individually in consultation with the CTO
• Individualized opportunities for professional development
• Being part of a global change movement
• Working in a diverse team with hard workers and real teamplayers
• Seeing the impact of your work, daily

Job-Title: Internship Machine Learning for Image Segmentation in Solder Joint...
Description:
Company Description

At Bosch, we shape the future by inventing high-quality technologies and services that spark enthusiasm and enrich people’s lives. Our promise to our associates is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and we inspire each other. Join in and feel the difference.

The Robert Bosch GmbH is looking forward to your application!

Job Description
• You will develop computer vision/machine learning algorithms to detect features such as cracks, voids and segmentation of various phases from solder joint microstructure images.
• Furthermore, you will work on the problem holistically from framework development, dataset design to training neural networks.
• Last but not least, you will collaborate with other teams to implement state-of-the-art solutions for reliable quantification of phases and defects in the solder joint microstructure.

Qualifications
• Education: studies in the field of Computer Science, Information Technology, Material Science, Natural Science... Engineering or comparable
• Personality and Working Practice: responsible, highly initiative, communicative, independent, goal- and team-oriented
• Experience and Knowledge: good knowledge of programming for image processing, experience with MATLAB or Python, Machine learning
• Languages: fluent in English, good in German

Additional Information

Start: March 2023

Duration: 6 months

We offer you:
• 35 hours/week with flextime
• a permanent contact person who will accompany you during your internship
• a modern working environment, as well as mobile working by arrangement
• the opportunity to become part of our student network students@bosch Stuttgart
• discounts in our company restaurants

Requirement for this internship is the enrollment at university. Please attach a motivation letter, your CV, transcript of records, enrollment certificate, examination regulations and if indicated a valid work and residence permit.

Diversity and inclusion are not just trends for us but are firmly anchored in our corporate culture. Therefore, we welcome all applications, regardless of gender, age, disability, religion, ethnic origin or sexual identity.

Need further information about the job?

Werner Hügel (Business Department)

+49 711 811 30801

Job-Title: Senior Big Data and Machine Learning Engineer (MLOps) (F/M)
Description:
Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.Apply now!

We’re looking for a Senior Big Data and Machine Learning Engineer (MLOps), with an entrepreneurial spirit to join our diverse team and work on innovation projects.

Role:

As a Big Data and Machine Learning Engineer (MLOps), you will contribute to the implementation of the “Machine Learning Workbench” of our Intelligent Enterprise Data Platform, covering the entire Machine Learning solution development life cycle (MLOps).

You will work closely with product... managers/product owners, scrum masters/release train engineers, AI/data scientists, data engineers, AI developers.

You will be involved in all aspects of entire customer lifecycle starting from ideation to creation & operationalising the solution. ?You play a key role to overall team’s success. You proudly present our team and solutions to stakeholders and act as team ambassador.

The ideal candidate will be able to work in a remote environment, handle multiple requests/initiatives and collaborate across multiple nationalities and continents. Your passion for organisation and details, along with your collaborative mindset on how to improve processes, will ensure a continuous improvement across all teams.

Responsibilities / Core Tasks:
• Develop & Extend high quality Machine Learning Workbench solutions
• Design, code and test new product features by following agile development practices
• Demonstrate excellent quality, design, development and delivery skills in scrum teams working in short development and release cycles
• Educate customers, partners and stakeholders about Data Engineering and MLOps practices
• Collaborate with SAP AI standard development to influence the roadmap of our standard products
• Plans, facilitate and lead workshops
• Contribute to team’s winning plan, present success story in Quarterly Business Review and report success back to higher level of organization

What you bring:

You are self-motivated, result-oriented, and creative. You bring can-do attitude and positive mindset. You are a team player, have a sharp business acumen and problem-solving skills with the ability to manage stakeholders and develop strong relationships. You are able to manage, organize, prioritize, multi-task and adapt to changing priorities. You are committed to continuous learning & sharing skills to others.
• Bachelor‘s or master’s degree in business informatics, computer science, engineering or related technical fields
• Passionate about Data Science, AI, Machine Learning and MLOps issues, and at least 3 years of experience in the field
• Strong practical knowledge of AI technologies from SAP BTP (eg AI Core) and Hyperscalers / 3rd party (eg Azure, Databricks)
• Python development at professional level
• Strong Knowledge of GitHub, Jenkins, Kubernetes and Docker
• Good presentation skills to explain complex concepts and technical solutions
• Solid understanding of a variety of Python libraries and Machine Learning frameworks (Numpy, Pandas, Keras, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, gensim, etc)
• Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills in English, incl. ability to communicate complex concepts in simple form to non-technical audience
• Solid understanding of agile team practice & methods such as Scrum, Kanban, SAFe
• Experience in leading teams as functional/technical leader

Meet your team:

SAP Intelligent Enterprise Solutions (IES) department has the purpose to “Deliver and Run the Intelligent Enterprise”. IES is SAP’s technology backbone and most compelling reference customer, and as such, we influence product development and strategy, with our customer experience at heart. Within IES, our “Artificial Intelligence CoE” team has the purpose to help SAP to transform into a data-driven intelligent enterprise, by empowering SAP employees to simplify processes, leveraging AI technologies. Our vision is to be an advocate and enabler of best-in-class AI within SAP.

Our mission is to deliver business value through AI in SAP’s processes and be recognized as AI Thought Leader in the market. We implement both standard SAP AI and custom built solutions across all LoBs. We are customer zero of SAP standard AI solutions and provide continuous feedback to standard development for product improvement. We provide an AI Platform and Infrastructure to entire SAP AI practitioners for building their own ML solutions in the entire ML lifecycle following MLOps methodology.

Furthermore, we build and operate a central chatbot platform based on SAP Conversational AI with the aim to provide capabilities from all lines of business through a single digital assistant. We also build those capabilities (individual chatbots) as well as support other teams in building further ones. Within our team, we practice a trust-based working model with emphasis on great collaboration, agility and transparency. We offer a lot of room for creativity and freedom to experiment. Our operating model is based on autonomous/agile team concept (SAFe) and SAP New Work practice where we put people at the center of everything we do

Job-Title: Machine Learning Engineers & Ho Chi Minh
Description:
Position: Machine Learning Engineers (Berlin & Ho Chi Minh City)

Retail Foundation is a startup that provides an all-in-one cloud solution for the e-commerce industry to capture, enrich, and distribute product content use AI and workflow automation to help our customers improve their product information management. As a spin-off of a consulting firm, we already have a large e-commerce company as a customer.

We are looking for 2 experienced Machine Learning Engineers (one in Berlin and another in Vietnam) to join our team and help us develop further our deep learning models for image processing and classification.

As part of our Product and AI team, you will
• Build, train, deploy and monitor machine learning models in production
• Build MLOps pipelines for machine learning workflows automation
• Work closely with the team to define solutions to concrete and diverse business use-cases
• Work with labeled as well as unstructured data
• Keep an eye on the latest research and tools to... increase the knowledge of the team
• Work together with colleagues in Germany and Vietnam

Requirements
• Qualification:

– You master at least one machine learning framework (Pytorch is strongly preferred, additional frameworks are a plus)

– you can write production-quality code in Python

– ideally, you have worked on multiple computer vision problems (especially classification and matting/segmentation).
• Experience

– You have experience with computer vision problems and deep learning pipelines, in particular in the context of image classification, object/character detection and recognition, and image segmentation in e-commerce domain
• Collaboration

– You are a team player and have worked in cross-functional teams before; you bring new ideas and ensure best practices are applied at every step
• Academic skills

– You are comfortable with reading research papers and evaluating their relevance to the use case at hand
• Problem solving – You keep a pragmatic approach and evaluate an array of solutions to a given issue: start simple and experiment
• Organization – You work in an iterative and structured approach, with a focus on value for the clients and the company
• Languages

– You are fluent in English as we are an international team. Some German knowledge is a plus but not a requirement
• You have the work right in either Germany or Vietnam

Benefits
• We have flat hierarchies and codetermination, just as you would expect from a startup.

You will have the opportunity to contribute your ideas and make a great impact on the company's direction
• We offer a flexible work policy, which allows our people to have the autonomy to schedule their work around their other commitments and personal needs. This can include options such as flexible working hours, remote work options and the ability to adjust start and finish times to suit individual needs. This policy is designed to support a healthy work-life balance, and to help our people perform at their best
• We offer generous vacation days, so you can take the time you need to recharge and come back to work refreshed
• Our team places a strong emphasis on building a positive and cohesive culture. That's why you'll often find our team's social activities in and outside the office that are connected to international culture. These activities provide an opportunity for us to bond, have fun, and be friends outside of work hours
• Endless supply of delicious refreshments - enjoy complimentary gourmet coffee, beverages, snacks, and fresh fruits
• Our office space is centrally located in Berlin or in Ho Chi Minh City, providing a modern and comfortable environment for you to do your best work
• For Berlin-based employees, we offer the opportunity to work in our second office in Ho Chi Minh City, this will give you the chance to gain international experience and expand your professional horizons

At Machine Learning Reply Germany we work with our clients on leading-edge data projects for which we are seeking (Big) Data Engineers to serve our cloud-based client projects in multiple industries

Machine Learning Reply, with its sister company in Italy and over 12.000 employees at Reply globally, is a fast-growing consultancy focused on solving problems with data intelligence and the right organizational frameworks as their backbone. We offer tailor-made end-to-end solutions in the Business Intelligence Ecosystem that cover the entire project lifecycle - from initial strategy consulting to data architecture and infrastructure issues to data processing, modeling and visualization.

We are a tight-knit, laid-back, but seriously motivated unit that aims to be involved at conferences and in the community of practices with our tech partners.

You will be working across technical domains and industries depending on the project scope and your interest.

Whether you are already... experienced in Data Engineering or just graduated having gained your first experience in data technologies - If you never lose focus, are you data-driven but with a passion for Cloud Computing? Then we want to hear from you!

Tasks:
• Support the successful implementation of customer products related to Big Data, Data Engineering, and/or Data Warehouses.
• Build and maintain scalable Data Platforms and Datalakes on Cloud or on-premise, considering DevOps paradigms.
• Build and maintain data-intensive applications with big data technologies like Apache Spark, Hadoop, and databases (SQL and NoSQL), using batch or real-time data integration (Kafka, RabbitMQ).
• Develop data pipelines and workflows utilizing technologies such as AirFlow and/or Luigi.

What we offer you:
• Access to work on projects across industries (large and mid-market companies in Banking, Insurance, Automotive, Retail, etc.)
• Broaden your skills through interdisciplinary work and training between the areas of data engineering, cloud architecture and data science
• Benefit from industry leading cooperations in the cloud, BI, and AutoML field
• Very active social program - including training, conferences, team buildings, Reply Exchange, communities of practices, and hackathons
• Work in an open, flat environment within a broad Reply knowledge-sharing network
• Award winning office space in downtown Munich with access to “Stammstrecke”
• You choose your state-of-the-art work equipment
• Public transport ticket within Munich
• Gym-membership subsidy for a gym of your choice
• Flexible work environment between client, Reply office and remote work.

Technical Qualifications
• You have a passion for building, maintaining, and deploying data-driven products utilizing Kubernetes, Docker, Microservices, and Terraform.
• You think in a DevOps mindset, applying CI/CD (e.g., Gitlab CI, Jenkins), integration tests, and unit tests.
• You demonstrate experience with Data and Cloud Computing platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure), and/or Databricks/SnowFlake.
• You have experience in Software Development and clean code in Python, Java, SQL, and/or Scala.

General Qualifications
• You have a high level of customer orientation and excellent communication skills.
• You are willing to travel.
• You are fluent in English and have at least intermediate proficiency (B1) in German (willing to improve).

Nice to Have
• You have knowledge and experience in Backend and/or Frontend Development or are willing to improve in those skills.
• You have previous experience in a consultant role within the Data stack

Site Name: Heidelberg - Office, Berlin Linkstrasse, Dresden - Office, Hamburg, Home Worker - DEU (Hamburg), Home Worker - DEU (Munich), Munich - Office
Posted Date: Jul 5 2021

Software Engineer, Biomedical AI

At GSK, we are actively working on building a future in which state-of-the-art software, Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) will enable us to develop new therapies and personalized drugs that drive better outcomes for patients at reduced cost with fewer side effects. It is an ambitious goal that requires the development of data-driven solutions at the cutting edge of Software Engineering, Automation, Biomedicine, Machine Learning and AI. If this excites you, we would love to chat.

To help us make this future a reality, we are looking for Software Engineers that have a track record in developing production grade data-driven software solutions. Software Engineers at GSK are outstanding engineers with in-depth knowledge in modern software craftsmanship... practices and a keen interest in making a positive impact in healthcare.

The Biomedical AI team is built on the principles of ownership, accountability, continuous development, and collaboration. We hire for the long term, and we are motivated to make this a great place to work. Our leaders will be committed to your career and development from day one. We strongly encourage applications from people with diverse and underrepresented backgrounds and perspectives.

You will:
• Design and implement data-driven software solutions along the entire software development life cycle, including requirements engineering, software design, implementation, testing, integration and maintenance.
• Deliver robust, tested and performant code in an agile development environment.
• Liaise with experts in biology, medicine and experimentation to ensure fit-for-purpose programming interfaces and data pipelines for data-driven software projects.

We are looking for:
• A degree in a quantitative or engineering discipline (e.g., computer science, computational biology, bioinformatics, engineering, among others); OR equivalent work experience as a professional software engineer.
• Demonstrated advanced programming expertise in Python and in developing and delivering robust software solutions.
• Knowledge of modern software development tools and practices (agile frameworks).
• Basic understanding of at least one major deep learning framework (PyTorch, TensorFlow).
• Knowledge of software engineering best practices, including continuous integration (CI) and continuous deployment (CD), containerization, and shell scripting.
• Background or interest in biology or medicine is a plus but not required.
• Fluency in English. Knowledge of German is not required for this position.

In addition, it would be nice if you bring:
• Experience in design, development and deployment of commercial data-driven software.
• Basic familiarity with machine learning principles and state-of-the-art modelling approaches.
• Contributions to relevant open-source projects.
• Knowledge or interest in disease biology, molecular biology and medicine.
• Experience working with biomedical data (e.g., genomics, transcriptomics, proteomics, electronic health records, clinical images)

Why GSK?

Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture.

These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork. As GSK focuses on our values and expectations and a culture of innovation, performance, and trust, the successful candidate will demonstrate the following capabilities:
• Agile and distributed decision-making – using evidence and applying judgement to balance pace, rigor and risk
• Managing individual and team performance.
• Committed to delivering high quality results, overcoming challenges, focusing on what matters, execution.
• Implementing change initiatives and leading change.
• Sustaining energy and well-being, building resilience in teams.
• Continuously looking for opportunities to learn, build skills and share learning both internally and externally.
• Developing people and building a talent pipeline.
• Translating strategy into action - a compelling narrative, motivating others, setting objectives and delegation.
• Building strong relationships and collaboration, managing trusted stakeholder relationships internally and externally.
• Budgeting and forecasting, commercial and financial acumen
• LI-GSK

#GSKAIML2021

Job Description

We are looking for a student (m/f/diverse) who is interested in an internship to support our project team in Berlin for a 3-month voluntary study-related internship or a mandatory internship for up to 6 months. There is also the possibility to combine a compulsory part with the voluntary study-accompanying internship.
As an intern (m/f/diverse), you will be working on investigating the application of self-supervised learning in object detection tasks for autonomous driving.
As part of the central pre-development department, our goal is to develop and enable the use of AI in future Continental products. You will work in a dedicated, innovative team of Continental employees (m/f/diverse) and Ph.D. students (m/f/diverse).

Your tasks will consist of the following:
• Collaborate with our project team on the research of State-of-the-Art (SOTA) solutions
• Implement self-supervised learning methods on autonomous driving datasets
• Development and extension of SOTA methods... for object detection tasks
• Design and code the solutions, starting with broadly defined problems
• Analyze the effect of self-supervised learning methods on the AI pipeline and monitor its performance during training process

Job Requirements
• Currently enrolled in a bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, machine learning or related field
• Intensively worked with artificial-intelligence-related algorithms
• Advanced programming skills in Python
• Safe handling of MS Office-programs
• Fluent in English spoken and written
• Must be able to work effectively in a team environment
• Independent, creative, and proactive working style
• Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
• Good presentation, oral and written communication skills highly desirable

Please attach your current certificate of enrollment and also your current transcripts of records and an extract of certificate for a mandatory internship. Those documents are mandatory for processing your application.

Applications from severely handicapped people are welcome.

About Continental

Continental develops pioneering technologies and services for sustainable and connected mobility of people and their goods. Founded in 1871, the technology company offers safe, efficient, intelligent and affordable solutions for vehicles, machines, traffic and transportation. In 2021, Continental generated sales of €33.8 billion and currently employs more than 190,000 people in 58 countries and markets. On October 8, 2021, the company celebrated its 150th anniversary.

What we offer

Job-Title: IMT 38-2022 Bachelor / Master Thesis or Internship: Deep Learning for...
Description: Area of research:Diplom & MasterPart-Time Suitability:The position is suitable for part-time employment.Starting date:13.09.2022Job description:Nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) has become indispensable in various research fields such as physics, chemistry and medicine. It provides a non-invasive and non-destructive method for examining a wide range of samples, for example, to find out the composition of SARS-CoV-2 at an atomic level. The outcome of such NMR measurements is often a spectrum, which precisely describes the content of the examined sample. Deep learning methods are currently utilized to process the spectrum and extract features. However, the spectra are often of high dimensions, and thus, the computational demands for processing them are high. Luckily, spectra contain unimportant information like noise, and a small set of variables can often describe the critical features. Your task: You will use deep learning techniques to compress spectra into a set of descriptive... features that are enough to reconstruct the spectrum from them. Specifically, autoencoders (or encoder-decoder networks) are a promising approach: The encoder compresses the input to a small latent representation, and the decoder can reconstruct the input given this latent space. Your task includes finding the most suitable autoencoder structure (e.g. VAE) to compress NMR spectra, and to implement a functioning pipeline in pytorch (or similar).You will be part of Prof. Korvink’s research group where you can get support from members with expertise in NMR theory, methodology, hardware, and simulation.This research center is part of the Helmholtz Association of German Research Centers. With more than 42,000 employees and an annual budget of over € 5 billion, the Helmholtz Association is Germany’s largest scientific organisation

Job-Title: Postdoctoral Scientist, Machine Learning: Cell Therapy
Description:
Janssen Research & Development (“JRD”), a Johnson & Johnson company, is recruiting for a Postdoctoral Scientist, Machine Learning: Cell Therapy, with the focus on High Dimensional Optimization and Decision Theory.

This position can be in multiple countries: Germany (Berlin or Neuss), Belgium (Beerse), Netherlands (Leiden), Spain (Madrid), United Kingdom (Buckinghamshire), Spring House, PA & La Jolla, CA.

Remote working may be considered on a case by case basis and if approved by the Company.

This is a 2-year fixed term contract, with up to 15% travel.

Janssen develops treatments that improve the health of people worldwide. Research and development areas encompass oncology, cardiovascular and metabolic disorders, immunology, pulmonary hypertension, neuroscience, and infectious disease. Our goal is to help people live longer, healthier lives. We have produced and marketed many first-in-class prescription medications and are poised to serve the broad needs of the healthcare market –... from patients to practitioners and from clinics to hospitals. To learn more about Janssen, one of the Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, visit https://www.janssen.com/janssen-rnd-data-science

The Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning team within Janssen R&D Data Science organization develops innovative insights and solutions by using multi modal datasets, advanced algorithms, and high performance computing across multiple disease areas.

We are looking for an outstanding post-doctoral scientist whose responsibilities will include:
• Analyze biochemical and biological datasets from various R&D labs to enhance the understanding of cell-level attributes by using high-dimensional data analysis and machine learning.
• Build novel or enhance existing machine learning/deep learning algorithms for AI-assisted discovery and development.
• Guide the design of new experiments and build predictive models by using supervised and unsupervised machine learning on historical experiments.
• Actively participate in building modeling and simulation pipelines to develop reusable software assets for the cell therapy platform.
• Participate in experimental design activities in collaboration with therapeutics discovery teams across Janssen, such as defining “what” and “why” particular quality attribute needs to be monitored.
• Communicate results to internal collaborators and external partners through project reports and peer-reviewed research publications

Position: Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d)
Location: Federal Republic of Germany
Xplain Data GmbH focuses on the development of innovative technologies in the field of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. Xplain Data algorithms enable companies in all industries to identify the few, potentially causal relationships in their "real world data" that are hidden behind a plethora of trivial correlations. Users can leverage these cause-and-effect insights to intervene in their business processes to achieve a desired goal.

Our customers include various enterprises in the healthcare and pharmaceutical sectors as well as leading manufacturing companies that use our technology for e.g., yield optimization and predictive maintenance.

BD4 is a market-leading provider of artificial intelligence (AI) driven personalization and real-time optimized online experiences.

Our mission is to deliver the most relevant and compelling shopping experience to each and every user in real time. The uniqueness of our award-winning solution is to "listen" and understand each individual end-user to present them with the most appropriate products, content and services at exactly the right time.

In doing so, BD4's AI technology ensures that all data collected improves the user experience in real time. In parallel, our clients can combine their market and product knowledge with AI to implement commercial strategies and present products that support their business strategy.

Our typical clients are medium to large travel, aviation and retail companies in numerous international markets. Our clients base includes companies like Expedia, EasyJet Holidays, Emirates, Europcar, DER Touristik, Hilton and Ab-in-den-Urlaub.

BD4 is headquartered... in Frankfurt am Main and serves customers in numerous international markets. We are majority-owned by dnata and are thus a company of the Emirates Group.

Due to our constantly growing customer base in different segments of the travel industry and the retail sector, we are strengthening our team with more great colleagues.

Tasks

You are a member of our data science team who develop and continuously improve our predictive models. These models are at the core of our products and give our customer – online travel portals – a detailed picture of their users' interests, intent and current experience on the site.
• Data mining and data analyses to generate new insights and open new business opportunities.
• Develop and improve our existing predictive, explanatory models and machine learning algorithms
• Create automated learning systems that gracefully scale to increasing complexity and expectation
• Help improve the scope of our data sets by identifying new data collection and procurement opportunities on an ongoing basis
• Conduct and collaborate on A/B tests and their evaluations to help us understand better how our products are performing
• Monitor the industry for promising new approaches and technologies and evaluate its potential by developing research prototypes
• Be part of an interdisciplinary Scrum team with engineers and work closely together with the product team as well to get enhancements or new models into production.

Requirements

The ideal candidate has several years hands-on and demonstrable experience in the field of data science, machine learning and data analysis. Furthermore, the following skills and experiences are required:
• Deep understanding of techniques and tools in data analysis, machine learning, and recommendation systems
• You have strong experience in machine learning frameworks, Python and other programming languages (eg. R, Spark, TensorFlow)
• Experience in designing analytics pipelines in Azure ML or other Cloud environments
• You have good business sense and are capable of thinking holistically about how insights and deliverables feed into the wider business strategy. You have the ability to quickly understand technical information, derive insights, build solutions and work independently and responsibly with attention to detail.
• You are an effective communicator with an ability to find stories in the insights and data and explain them to diverse audiences. A creative, curious and analytical mind able to layout facts and figures to tell a clear story
• You are comfortable working with data and have practical experience with quantitative data analysis & visualization, BI tools (e.g. PowerBI), SQL queries and data pipelines. Good programming knowledge (ideally in python and pyspark) and a solid understanding of machine learning techniques is preferred. Experience working with big data tools is a plus
• You are a team player and you like working in an agile environment
• Proficiency in written and spoken English is required

Benefits

What we offer

Our office is located on the fourth floor above the rooftops of Frankfurt - in the multicultural district of Rödelheim. With over 600 sqm of open space office plus 300 sqm of outdoor space, everyone will find a suitable place to work. On the spacious terraces with skyline view, you can not only work in the fresh air, but also have lunch with colleagues, barbecue or enjoy your after-work beer (or coke!). Of course, there are also options for "mobile working".

What else do we have to offer?
• A young company with a multicultural start-up culture and flat hierarchies.
• Our office is conveniently located with a direct S-Bahn connection and infrastructure (and a secure bike cellar!)
• Exciting challenges within the framework of an innovative and international company
• Free drinks, fruit, snacks and regular company events, yoga classes etc. as well as after-work activities
• An attractive compensation and benefits package

If this sounds like you and you’re excited to find a successful international start-up with grown-up ideas about how to do business, please send us your application right away. If you have any questions, we are happy to assist you.

We are looking forward to your application

Data Science Interns at QuantCo's European offices will learn what it takes to create impact from data: identifying the right framework and questions to translate a business challenge into a statistical problem; locating and combining data sources as well as transforming large datasets; running in-depth analyses; building machine learning models that automate large-scale decisions and integrating them into live business processes; and interpreting, visualizing, and communicating results to internal and external stakeholders.

We are looking for team players who have excellent quantitative abilities and:
• A major, minor, or research focus in economics, statistics, mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, or similar fields at a leading university (B.Sc., M.Sc., or PhD)
• In-depth understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts behind most common machine learning techniques and a proven interest in causal inference questions, e.g., A/B tests
• Experience in coding and... working with data (from a previous research or industry internship or extensive course projects) using a wide range of tools and languages: Python (Pandas, XGBoost/LightGBM), R (dplyr, ggplot2), and git
• Ability to see solutions and opportunities that others do not see
• High level of commitment and reliability, good balance of pragmatism and perfectionism
• Business proficiency in English and conversational proficiency in German for our German and Swiss offices

Bonus if skilled in any of the following tools and/or languages:
• SQL
• Tensorflow
• Keras
• Cloud infrastructure
• Docker
• Lower-level languages like C#/C++/C

What we offer

You will be part of a smart, motivated, and driven team that revels in working on challenging problems and finding novel solutions; values our customers and users; and strives to deliver thoughtful and impactful products. You will be surrounded by people that respect each other and the contributions each of us brings. We offer a generous compensation package that includes a base salary, bonus, relocation and housing support along with additional location-based benefits. We accept internship applications year-round for summer and off-cycle periods.

About QuantCo

We leverage expertise in data science, engineering, and economics to help organizations turn data into decisions. Started by four PhDs from Harvard and Stanford, we are now about 100 professionals with extensive quantitative, engineering, and business experience.

QuantCo’s product line includes algorithmic pricing, data-driven claims management, and high-dimensional forecasting solutions. Our clients are some of the largest financial, retail, and healthcare organizations in the U.S. and Europe.

We are excited about writing code that affects millions of people and impacts billions of dollars. If you feel the same way, we look forward to hearing from you

Job-Title: Software Developer - 3D Scene & Object Reconstruction using Machine Learning
Description:
The Fraunhofer IIS »Audio and Media Technologies« division has been making its mark on media digitalization for over 30 years, developing pioneering standards such as MP3 and AAC. Motivated by this success, we aim to address new challenges in 3D reconstruction for media and communication applications.

What you will do

You aim to bring novel algorithms into efficient implementations?

Then join our team and help us making digital photorealistic 3D copies of favorite objects or scenes accessible to everybody.
• You will work in a cooperative team of researchers who are passionate about the challenge of easily creating 3D models with much better quality than today.

• Starting from novel algorithms that we design to achieve our goals, you will define a software architecture that allows for fast processing, future extension and maintenance.

C++ is a plusGood understanding of the success factors for modern software development (ideally in the context of machine learning) and a strong agile DevOps mindsetBroad knowledge of the ML/DL development process and data pipelinesFluent in English, German is a plusAdditional InformationCentrally located, modern work spaces30 days of vacation plus 24.12. and 31.12.Flexible working hours as well as hybrid work model within GermanySecure bicycle storage roomRegular after-work, team & company eventsGreat 212m² roof terraceInternational team of supportive colleaguesComprehensive training and continuing education opportunitiesInterested? We are Text Cortex AI and are on a mission to enable 100x more businesses to matter in the digital space. Our belief is that AI language generation should be accessible in any text box there is online.

That's why we have built a platform that empowers individual writers and businesses to create faster, create more and create better content in the text-intensive digital marketing game.

There has never been a more exciting time to join us. Since our launch, we have been installed by over 3500 users, created more than 5m words, and have an active bunch of power users who use our software to reduce their work by 70%! We have raised capital from Entrepreneur First, a fund being backed by Reid Hoffman (Founder of LinkedIn) and Peter Thiel (Founder of PayPal), and have assembled a set of strong seed investors for the future. (undisclosed)

Together with you we want to change how we are writing all the text online.

Be an early part of one of the 200 hottest European AI startups according... to DT2 Invest and the European Commission!

Tasks

What we are looking for?

We want to be transparent with you, this position is not for everyone. We are looking for our first key hire to take responsibility and leadership in developing our natural language generation algorithms even further side by side with our experienced CTO. Somebody who is well accustomed and not afraid to jump from data collection to text prediction, from the code to the whiteboard. Somebody who starts with a good base to grow with the trajectory of the company.

We know that the below areas could each be filled by an own team and in two years it will be. However, for now, we look for somebody who wants to put skin in the game, roll up their sleeves together with us and drive our growth.

Areas you will work with:
• Natural language generation - For now we are working mostly with different transformer architectures. Seeing ourselves as model-agnostic we are continuously experimenting with what leads to the best language generation
• Model and data management - Our biggest assets are the datasets and the models we a continuously creating. You will have a major impact at the very core of our company.
• Model and pipeline performance - Improving current processes and pipelines to run even more resource-efficient. Currently we have reached same performance levels as OpenAI GPT-3 with 20x smaller models. We would like to push this even further and make text generation as fast as possible.
• Data Acquisition - We value strong datasets to achieve outstanding results with our technology. Creativity in searching and acquiring the best data is the strongest moat we create. On top of writing scrapers to collect data, you should also be able to apply NLP techniques to further augment our raw datasets further.
• Cloud Computing - We started with a server under the founder's desk moving to build cloud-agnostic software. Having experience with GCP and AWS is a must have.

Requirements

What you should bring along
• Past experience, a portfolio of past work and experience or a degree in machine learning, statistics, data science, or a related field.
• AI and/or SaaS Experience, from a fast-growing seed to a series A company.
• Tech Stack, deep knowledge in Python with experience in frameworks such as Pytorch, CUDA, Transformers, Tensorflow.
• Cloud Native, we are running all our compute operations on Cloud providers such as GCP and AWS. We expect you to have sufficient proficiency in managing resources that is needed for inferencing and training on cloud products.
• Outstanding analytical skills, demonstrated ability to break down complex problems, ability to frame the right questions, objectively analyze and evaluate a problem or issue, and problem-solve including simulating possible outcomes.
• Growth ownership, show us how your past experiences tie in our early challenges
• Domain knowledge with previous demonstrated experience in growing SaaS products around SME, Enterprise, and content software
• Thirst for growth, you are on the verge from tactician to strategist and want to grow at the same speed the company grows
• Outstanding writing skills, we are a team of passionate writers ourselves. We see the written word as a key for communicating internally as well as externally, the ability to effectively cause both understanding and action in others without the use of the written word is essential.
• Ability to execute, you can get things done fast and influence people towards a particular objective.
• Entrepreneurial mindset to seek opportunities to help with all aspects of the technology - act like an owner with the goal to make correct decisions;
• Fluent in English; All our communications are written and in English.

Benefits

Benefits & Perks

Job-Title: Postdoctoral fellowship in machine learning for next-generation biomedicine
Company: German Center for Neurodegenerative Diseases DZNE
Description:
This is an opportunity to work on advanced machine learning methodology for complex scientific questions at one of Germany's flagship biomedical institutions. The position is within in the Mukherjee Group, which focuses on machine learning methodology for next-generation biomedicine. Current focus areas include deep causal learning, high-dimensional problems and scientifically-interpretable modelling, with applications in large-scale molecular biology and omics as well as deep phenotyping.

We are looking for highly qualified candidates in machine learning, AI or statistics, with an interest in methodological research, motivated by, and applied to, large-scale biomedical data. We are particularly interested in candidates with strong methodological expertise in one or more of causality, deep neural networks and high-dimensional methods. Prior experience in biomedical research is not required. The working language is English and knowledge of German is not... required.

Requirements

Candidates (f/m/x) should have, or shortly expect to receive, a PhD in machine learning, statistics, computer science, applied mathematics (or related fields) with a strong background in machine learning or computational statistics. A solid background in machine learning and statistical fundamentals and strong ML/statistical computing skills (in one or more of Python, R, etc.) are important.

We offer

Job-Title: Research Engineer for AI solutions over knowledge graphs (f/m/div.)
Description:
Company Description

At Bosch, we shape the future by inventing high-quality technologies and services that spark enthusiasm and enrich people’s lives. Our promise to our associates is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and we inspire each other. Join in and feel the difference.

The Robert Bosch GmbH is looking forward to your application!

Job Description

Over the last few years, Bosch has established the Bosch Center for Artificial Intelligence (BCAI) as one of the leading enterprise research centers for AI. We are a motivated global team with the mission to incubate, create and roll out AI solutions to Bosch. We work closely with domain experts on exciting Bosch problems for real world applications to transform Bosch into a knowledge-driven company.
We are looking for a Research Engineer to support our research team working on state-of-the-art AI solutions over knowledge graphs and neuro-symbolic research in an Enterprise setting. You will support us in software... development activities for transferring our research results in real-world systems. Concretely, your tasks will include:
• Implementation, evaluation and integration of
• end-to-end AI solutions for knowledge graphs in the industrial context
• proof of concept prototype development for machine learning, analytics and exploration methods for knowledge graphs
• rule-based AI methods for combinatorial problems over knowledge graphs
• state-of-the-art neuro-symbolic AI methods over knowledge graphs
• Creation of clean, efficient, well-tested and well-documented code.
• Implementation support for ongoing research activities on neuro-symbolic AI: experiments, evaluation.

Qualifications
• Education: PhD or MSc in Neuro-symbolic AI, Knowledge Representation, Automated Reasoning or Machine Learning
• Personality:  a formidable team player with a passion for creating beautifully written code, keen to learn new technologies and share knowledge while being able to work independently
• Working Practice: independently, motivated, goal-oriented and pro-active
• Experience and Knowledge:
• strong background and more than 3 years of experience in writing well-structured, maintainable and reliable code
• pofound skills in several programming languages, including Python, Java and/or C++
• ability to develop web services (rest APIs), user interfaces, and software tools and/or libraries
• enthusiastic about applying software development processes (e.g. agile software development)
• flexibility and knowledge dealing with different operation systems including Linux systems
• hands on experience with development and operation of machine-learning models, solution architecture of on-premises and cloud deployments
• hands on experience with ontologies, OWL, RDF data, triple stores, graph databases, SPARQL, and database management systems
• experience in development and implementation of state-of-the-art machine learning technologies (e.g., knowledge graph embedding methods) and with answer set programming
• experience with discrete/continuous optimization, with reasoning tools such as ontology/rule-based reasoners and with CD/CI and DevOps tooling, e.g. Docker and Kubernetes is a plus
• Enthusiasm:  for fully automated, tested, continuously deployed, and delivered services and you are a strong team player, highly self-motivated, interested in bringing latest research solutions into projects and services
• Languages:  fluent in English

Additional Information

Please submit all relevant documents (CV, letter of motivation, certificates, and links to GitHub).

Job-Title: 74210: MSc. in Computer Science, Aerospace, Mechanical Engineering or...
Description:
Area of research:Scientific / postdoctoral posts,OtherJob description:The Institute of System Architectures in Aeronautics models aviation as a system spanning multiple levels, from the improvement of the entire transportation system via the design of future air vehicles to the consideration of the production of subcomponents. Research aims at developing novel system architectures, i.e. considering the interaction of all elements in this system of systems. In this way, the DLR Institute is working to establish the future paradigm for the design and optimization of products and systems. Using this, innovative aircraft systems can be realized in a time- and cost-efficient manner.For this purpose, digital design methods such as Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) and Multidisciplinary Design Optimization (MDO) are increasingly applied. This development is made possible by holistic approaches to modeling the product and operating environment, which are accompanied by a steady increase... in digital models and data along the entire product life cycle. The handling of these very large amounts of data, respectively their evaluation and especially the derivation of knowledge for the design of improved products represents a central challenge in today’s product development processes. A promising approach to make interdependencies in the ever-growing design space tangible and usable is found in the application of machine learning (ML) methods, whose rapid development has produced a variety of possibilities for knowledge inference based on large data sets in recent years. In addition to the increasing understanding of dependencies in the higher-level design space, there is the possibility of generating knowledge fragments for generative product design based on Knowledge Based Engineering (KBE) techniques. Enabling this capability enlarges the potential to obtain even better products by effectively evaluating and including previously unused data in the design process.Therefore, we are looking for a new employee, having PhD aspirations, focusing on the identification of which ML methods are most suited for knowledge inference along the entire design process and to work out how these can be made accessible in the design process for the design of future complex system architectures in aviation in a user-oriented way.Your main tasks will be: development of methodological competences in the field of machine learning (ML) identification of existing data/data sets along the entire aviation system, as well as their classification with regard to their suitability for knowledge inference development and user-oriented provision of software to support data exploration and knowledge inference using ML methods

This research center is part of the Helmholtz Association of German Research Centers. With more than 42,000 employees and an annual budget of over € 5 billion, the Helmholtz Association is Germany’s largest scientific organisation

Job-Title: STUDENT ASSISTANT FOR OPTIMIZING 3D RECONSTRUCTION USING MACHINE LEARNING
Description:
The Competence Center for Cultural Heritage Digitization at Fraunhofer IGD develops and automates 3D scanning technologies using photogrammetry, structured light, laser and robotics. These technologies allow efficient 3D reconstruction of cultural heritage and industry objects. Multiple criteria must be evaluated to construct precise 3D models in reproducible and standardized quality. These evaluations can take a lot of time and can be accelerated using machine learning.

What you will do

The main task is to develop and train different methods to optimize and speed up intermediate reconstructed 3D models that are used during scanning. Different kinds of datasets must be generated for training and evaluation by using tools e.g. Blender. These machine learning methods must be modified for computations on a GPU cluster. Finally, there are hands-on tests with the corresponding 3D scanner.

In addition, stable metrics that provide sufficient information about the quality of the... reconstructed 3D model should be developed. The goal is to use these metrics already during the scanning process as preliminary information to predict better scanning positions. This will implicitly lead to an increase in the overall accuracy of the final, reconstructed 3D model, and thus improve the performance of the entire scanning system
